content:
The Windows OS version that replaced C:\Documents and Settings with C:\Users is Windows Vista.

Windows Vista, released in January 2007, introduced a new user folder structure and replaced the old C:\Documents and Settings folder with C:\Users. This change was made to simplify the user folder structure and make it more consistent across different languages and locales. This change also made it easier for users to find their files and documents, as the new folder structure was more intuitive.

The C:\Users folder contains separate folders for each user account on the computer, with each user's documents, settings, and other files stored in their respective folders. This change was carried forward in all the later versions of Windows OS, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows 10 and so on.
